list.name: Changes
list.comment: Implemented User Story 11 by applying the strategy design pattern and utilizing an interface to handle logging outputs, making the code easily extendable for future additions.

task.summary: Default task
Text Formatter finished, Done half in class and worked on it individually at home
Text Formatter finished, Done half in class and worked on it individually at home
Implemented user story 1 of event logger, by adding a single, thread-safe, and centralized logger instances. Added some instances in Main to test them out as well.
Implemented user story 1 of event logger, by adding a single, thread-safe, and centralized logger instances. Added some instances in Main to test them out as well.
Implemented user story 1 of event logger, by adding a single, and centralized logger instances. Added some instances in Main to test them out as well.
Implemented user story 2 of event logger, where there user can log messages based on different severity levels and print the message.
Implemented user story 3 of event logger, where the user can now save the log messages down and print them out whenever.
Implemented user story 3 of event logger, where the user can now save the log messages down and print them out whenever.
Made the Main method to write logs to console
Implemented user story 5 that can saves the history log messages into a file called messages.log

Implemnented user story 6 where making Logger instancce is synchronized to ensure that only one thread can create the Logger instance. This guarantees that the singleton instance is initialized safely, even in a multi-threaded environment.

Implemnented user story 6 where making Logger instancce is synchronized to ensure that only one thread can create the Logger instance. This guarantees that the singleton instance is initialized safely, even in a multi-threaded environment.

Implemnented user story 6 where making Logger instancce is synchronized to ensure that only one thread can create the Logger instance. This guarantees that the singleton instance is initialized safely, even in a multi-threaded environment.
Implemented User Story 7, which enables on-demand archiving of logs using a specified naming convention to differentiate between the log history and archived logs.
Implemented User Story 8 to provide customization and flexibility in selecting the logger's output destination.
Implemented User Story 9 to include timestamps in each log entry, formatted as day-month-year hour:minute:second.
Implemented User Story 9 to include timestamps in each log entry, formatted as day-month-year hour:minute:second.
Implemented User Story 9 to include timestamps in each log entry, formatted as day-month-year hour:minute:second.
Implemented User Story 10 by creating a dedicated method to format all log entries before any processing ensuring uniform formatting across all entries.
Implemented User Story 11 by applying the strategy design pattern and utilizing an interface to handle logging outputs, making the code easily extendable for future additions.

MESSAGE.value: Text Formatter finished, Done half in class and worked on it individually at home

Implemented user story 5 that can saves the history log messages into a file called messages.log

Implemnented user story 6 where making Logger instancce is synchronized to ensure that only one thread can create the Logger instance. This guarantees that the singleton instance is initialized safely, even in a multi-threaded environment.
Implemented User Story 7, which enables on-demand archiving of logs using a specified naming convention to differentiate between the log history and archived logs.
Implemented User Story 8 to provide customization and flexibility in selecting the logger's output destination.
Implemented User Story 9 to include timestamps in each log entry, formatted as day-month-year hour:minute:second.
Implemented User Story 10 by creating a dedicated method to format all log entries before any processing ensuring uniform formatting across all entries.
Implemented User Story 11 by applying the strategy design pattern and utilizing an interface to handle logging outputs, making the code easily extendable for future additions.
